[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: write_file()] [Inode Exhaustion] Can repeated calls to File::create() at line 44 without cleanup exhaust filesystem inodes, preventing future config saves and causing validator failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [No Version Checking] Does load_config() validate config file versions or timestamps, or can attackers replay old configs that lack security fixes, reintroducing vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [No Monotonic Versioning] Does save_config() enforce monotonically increasing version numbers in SafetyRulesConfig, or can attackers downgrade configs to earlier, less secure versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [No Backup Mechanism] Does the implementation support atomic backup creation before overwriting configs, or can failed save operations destroy both old and new SafetyRulesConfig data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Backup File Loading] Can attackers trick validators into loading .bak or temporary config files with malicious content by manipulating file paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: write_file()] [Key Material in Buffers] Does write_all() at line 46 properly zero sensitive key material from buffers after writing SafetyRulesConfig, or can it remain in memory for garbage collection to handle? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: read_config_file()] [Plaintext Key Storage] Does read_to_string() at line 34 expose consensus keys in plaintext when loading SafetyRulesConfig, rather than using encrypted storage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Partial Read Corruption] If read_config_file() at line 34 reads a file being actively modified, can partial reads cause validators to parse incomplete SafetyRulesConfig leading to undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: parse_serialized_config()] [Encoding Mismatch] Can mismatched character encodings between save and load cause SafetyRulesConfig data corruption, especially for non-ASCII configuration values? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Remote File Loading] Can load_config() be exploited to load configs from network paths (NFS, SMB), enabling man-in-the-middle attacks on SafetyRulesConfig? (High)
